data.title: Switzerland In June: Top Places To Visit & Things To Do In 2024
data.meta_description: Switzerland in June 2024 is the perfect time to explore the best of this country on your next soothing holiday. Take a look at this pocket guide.
data.text:
Switzerland is a land of many of our dreams. But the question is when to visit it? Now, this is where it gets a little tricky. The whole year round, Switzerland presents its visitors with a different scenario, a different atmosphere, which are again differently suitable for different kinds of activities. So, the kind of vacation you are looking for, and the kind of activities you intend to indulge in, will decide the time that is best for you to visit the country. However, we suggest that visiting Switzerland in June will be the perfect time for you to visit the land of extreme hospitality and punctuality, irrespective of the kind of vacation you are looking for or the kind of activities you are looking for. And we have our points to back up our statement. Just read them to find them out for yourself.

Switzerland Weather In June 2024

Image Source

The average temperature on an average June day in Switzerland comes to about 16°C, which on later days, could go up to 23°C. The highest it goes up to 21°C, while the lowest comes down to 11°C. The maximum time between sunrise and sundown could go up to as much as 12 hours. It is the perfect time to visit, as in June, snowfall just starts to reduce so that you get a chance to enjoy the Swiss wonderland before summer seeps in. There is moderate rainfall during this month, which ranges between 137-173 mm.

Must Read: Interlaken Restaurants

Reasons For Visiting Switzerland In June

Image Source

Here is why we insist that June is the best month to visit Switzerland irrespective of what is in your mind. Firstly, June is the bordering month of the Swiss shoulder season. Shoulder seasons are those during which the weather is the best, and there aren’t a huge number of tourists. Means, you have the place to yourself. June is the best you can get close to the warmest without having to face a huge number of tourists. Moreover, there are about 50% rises in the prices. Hence June! However, for those of you who are diehard fans of snow sports like skiing, winter is the best time for you, i.e. between December and March. There will be intense snowstorms and a large quantity of snow.

Top Places To Visit In Switzerland in June

Wondering what to see in Switzerland in June? Here is the perfect list of places that you can visit in Switzerland in June. Keep scrolling down and read along!

Zurich

Lucerne

Geneva

Interlaken

1. Zurich

A land of beautiful churches and serene lakes, Zurich is one of the best places to visit in Switzerland in June. If you are in Zurich with your beloved then you must visit Mühlesteg Bridge. This bridge is one of the most romantic places that you can visit with your beloved. This bridge has a lot of locks that are a symbol of love and you must make a wish at this spot. Other places that you can visit in Zurich are Grossmunster Church, Lake Zurich, Swiss National Museum and St. Peter Church.

Famous For: Urbanised districts, cultural and historical landmarks

Suggested Read: Switzerland In March

2. Lucerne

Known as the gateway city to Switzerland, Lucerne is popular for its medieval architecture, food culture and shopping spots. If you are a shopping fan or a foodie, this city will satisfy you in every sense. In the month of June, Lucerne looks heavenly and the places that you must visit in the city are Chapel Bridge, Lion Monument and the Swiss Museum of Transport. Do visit famous restaurants like Geissmatt and Grottino 1313.

Famous For: Medieval architecture, shopping centres

3. Geneva

If you are visiting Switzerland in June then Geneva is a city that you shouldn’t miss out on. Geneva is the second-most populous city in Switzerland and attracts a lot of tourists every year. The reason behind Geneva being one of the most visited cities in Switzerland by history enthusiasts is the ancient museums located here. You can visit some of Switzerland’s s most famous museums like the Ariana Museum, Art And History Museum, Museum Of Modern And Contemporary Art And The International Museum Of The Reformation.

Famous For: Cosmopolitan city, historic landmarks, and elegant architecture.

Suggested Read: Switzerland In May

4. Interlaken

For all the adventure buffs, Switzerland’s adventure capital is the perfect place to visit in the country. There are a plethora of enticing things to do in Interlaken that you must try. From water rafting to paragliding, Interlaken offers all kinds of thrilling activities to all adventure seekers. You can try the Funicular Ride or head out for a quick hiking session and witness the beauty of this city. Do add this marvellous city to your itinerary.

Famous For: Adventure sports, Hiking

Top Things To Do In Switzerland In June

If you have decided on visiting Switzerland in June 2024, here are a few activities you could indulge in. with winters just out, this is the best time for you to go hiking and trekking. It is the best time to visit places and explore, as at this time you practically have Switzerland to yourself, with all other tourists gone, and prices dropping crazy. Here are a few things to do in Switzerland in June!

Hikes

Lakes

Cable Cars And Cogwheel Trains

Pass Roads

Swimming And Sunbathing

1. Hikes

Image Source

With the snow out for the time, this is the time for you to go on hikes and trekking expeditions. Hiking in Switzerland in June can be an enthralling experience. Without the snow, you could go on trails as high as 2000 meters from sea level. From those heights, you will be presented with excellent views of the higher, inaccessible for the time being, ice-capped peaks. This is surely one of the best things to do in Switzerland in June with your squad, especially if you are in pursuit of a real adventure!

Suggested Read: Switzerland Tourist Attractions

2. Lakes

Image Source

In Switzerland, you will find a number of scenic lakes to visit and spend time around. You could also arrange a tiny picnic with your loved ones to one of those lakes. Although, we have a few names that exceptionally stand out. Be it the scenery against which they are located, or be it their geographical location or even the lake themselves. You should not miss out on Lake Maggiore, neither should you not visit lake Lugano, which is on the Italian-Swiss border. Be sure, however, to carry your passport while visiting Lake Lugano.

3. Cable Cars And Cogwheel Trains

Image Source

Riding the Swiss cable trains is every traveller’s dream. And that could come true for you in June. During the low seasons, the cable cars and cogwheel rides are closed down, mostly because of the snow situation. But in June, they start operating once again, multiplying your chances of looking down at the scenic views of Switzerland, from high up in the sky.

Cogwheel train rides are another excitement you might not want to miss out on. However, not all might prefer to go on one such rode, especially the one up the Alpine mountains that is super steep, dizzying to most.

Suggested Read: Places To Visit In Switzerland In Winter

4. Pass Roads

Image Source

Once spring arrives, chances for you to explore Switzerland multiply. The scenic pass roads open up. So, you can access the places on the other sides of the pass roads unhindered. One such place to visit is Lucerne. An input to this place is possible through the Swill Travel Pass. However, if you don’t have one, issuing the Golden Pass will do the job. It is best to take these scenic passes on one of the luxurious, rich in heritage, Swiss trains.

5. Swimming And Sunbathing

Image Source

Spring and summer naturally call for outdoor activities. The places come to life, and the weather turns pleasant. And at this wonderful juncture, Zurich provides you with the best opportunities to bask in the sun. Go by the Lake Zurich, or up to the banks of Zurich’s rivers, and you are open to swimming in them or just laying down to sunbathe. Moreover, there are over 40 swimming pools in the whole of Zurich. By swimming pools, we mean all water bodies we mean artificial outdoor pools, rivers, and lakes.

While there are a lot more activities for you to do in Switzerland in June, we have only provided the highlights to you. In fact, there is a never-ending list of things to do here. Even a lifetime could fall short, depending on your speed. So, be sure to explore more.

Places To Stay In Switzerland In June

Confused about where to stay in Switzerland in June? Switzerland has a lot of luxury hotels where you can stay on your vacation. Here is the list of the best ones!

Renaissance Zurich Tower Hotel

Hotel Storchen

Radisson Blu Hotel

Four Seasons Hotel Des Bergues

1. Renaissance Zurich Tower Hotel

Image Source

A superb 5-star hotel, with excellent soundproof rooms, and the whole 5-star experience. Each room in the hotel comes with a unique view of the city. Pretty close to the Swiss National Museum, and the Zurich Opera House, it provides you with the perfect evening activities.

Location: Turbinenstrasse, Zürich, Switzerland

2. Hotel Storchen

Image Source

Storchen is a 4-star hotel, situated in Limmatquai. This place runs along the river and gives you excellent views of the west side. Along with their in-house bar offering exquisite live piano music, the guests surely enjoy digging into the Swiss breakfast from their buffet menu. You can surely enjoy most of the cultural attractions as they’re all close by within a walking distance from the hotel.

Location: Weinplatz ,Zurich Old Town City Center, Zurich, Switzerland

Suggested Read: Adventure Sports In Switzerland

3. Radisson Blu Hotel

Image Source

Radisson Blu Hotel is a famous name of the hotel chain spread throughout the major cities in the world. As far as Lucerne is considered, this hotel is one of the best ones where you can stay on your vacation. From spacious room to outstanding location, Radisson Blu Hotel in Lucerne has it all. Get ready to be pampered with top-notch services and a terrific view from your room. All the main tourist attractions, shopping spots, and restaurants are located near this hotel.

Location: Lakefront Centre, 6005 Luzern, Switzerland

4. Four Seasons Hotel Des Bergues

Image Source

If you are planning to visit Switzerland in June and are thinking about exploring Geneva, then you must stay at Four Seasons Hotel Des Bergues. This impeccable hotel was designed by architect Pierre-Yves Rochon and was established in 1834. Considered as one of the magnificent historical buildings in Genever, this hotel provides all kinds of services to its guests. This hotel aims to pamper its guests with rooms with chic interiors, delectable food and other amazing facilities.

Location: Quai des Bergues 33, 1201 Genève, Switzerland

Suggested Read: 3 Days In Switzerland

What To Pack For Switzerland In June

Here is a short list of items you could put in your bags while you prepare for Switzerland and have an amazing holiday experience amid the land of the alps.

Water-resistant shoes, or boots

Wet weather gear like Goretex jacket.

Over pants for the rain

Shorts, long sleeve shirts, and hats for the hikes and treks

Pants with zip-off legs, preferably to adapt to the weather

Fleece clothing

Umbrella

So, this is our suggestion for your upcoming trip to Switzerland. You must be content with our arguments and hence cannot wait to make the plans. Well, plan well for Switzerland in June, and plan to move around, as moving around will give you a larger experience. Happy holidays.

Frequently Asked Questions About Switzerland In June

Is there snow in Switzerland in June?

Yes, you can find snow at the mountain tops in Switzerland in June.

What is Switzerland famous for?

With some of the world's best inventions, Switzerland is famous for The Velcro, Swiss army knife, potato peeler, Helvetica font, muesli, edible chocolate gold, cellophane, and milk chocolate to name a few.

When does Switzerland experience the warmest weather?

The warm months of Switzerland are June, July, and August. Amongst these, the temperature is highest during mid-July and stays around 22.7°C.

When can I get low airfare for a trip to Switzerland?

Swiss travels are generally expensive. If you are a budgeted traveller, plan your visit to Switzerland in the winter months of November to March. It is easy to find great deals on airfare during this time.

Are Euros acceptable in Switzerland?

The only currency that is accepted everywhere in Switzerland is the Swiss Franc. Euro is a foreign currency, so if anyone accepts it in Switzerland, you will get the change in Swiss francs.

Is it cold round the year in Switzerland?

No, the Swiss climate is not as cold as people generally think. The Alps experience snow throughout the year. Hence, the mountainous regions are colder and the plains are warmer.
